column4: hi all, what is the syntax for mount a ntfs partition with permissions read-write-execute to put in the fstab?
you can install ntfs-config and you'll have a nice simple gui that does it for you :)
: will this erase the lines i manually put in the fstab?
/dev/<YOUR DRIVE> /media/Windows ntfs-3g defaults,locale=en_US.UTF-8 0 0
: is this line added manually without installation of ntfs-config?
yes.
: ok i'll try thanks
add that line rather than installing ntfs-config... i wasn't sure how confident you were to hand-edit fstab :)
: i get "mount: unknown filesystem type 'ntfs-3g' "
sudo apt-get install ntfs-3g
: what does ntfs-3g do exactly?
it is the drivers that allow linux to 'talk' ntfs
: does ntfs-3g change my grub file?
no
: THANKS, it worked :D
great !:D
: i just hoped it didn't do anything to my grub file cause i had to modify a line to be able to boot Ubuntu on my sata drive
no, ntfs-3g doesn't have anything to do with grub, you're fine
